title: How to Make Mini Frittatas

steps.headline: Preheat your oven to 375°F (190°C) and grease two regular-sized, 12-well muffin pans.
steps.description: This recipe will give you about 20 frittatas. You can also use two 24-well mini muffin tins instead. This will give you about 40 extra-small frittatas. Make sure that the baking rack is in the middle of the oven.

steps.headline: Whisk together the eggs, milk, pepper and salt.
steps.description: Crack open the eggs into a large mixing bowl. Add the milk, pepper, and salt. Whisk everything together until the yolks break and the mixture turns pale yellow. You can adjust the amounts of salt and pepper to suit your tastes.

steps.headline: Add in the ham, cheese, and parsley.
steps.description: If you have not already, chop the ham into smaller pieces. Add it into the mixing bowl, along with the cheese and parsley. Stir everything together with a rubber spatula, scrapping the bottom and sides of the bowl often. If you can't find fresh parsley, use 2 teaspoons of dried parsley instead. If you don't like Parmesan, of can't find any, Cheddar cheese would make a great, tasty substitute.

steps.headline: Fill the muffin wells with the mixture.
steps.description: Use a soup or sauce ladle to fill the wells about ⅔ of the way. You have enough mixture to fill about 20 regular-sized muffin wells, or 40 mini muffin wells.

steps.headline: Bake the frittatas until they set.
steps.description: This will take about 20 to 25 minutes for regular-sized  muffin pans and 8 to 10 minutes for mini muffin wells. As they bake, the frittatas will puff up slightly.

steps.headline: Serve the mini frittatas.
steps.description: Pop them out of the wells using a fork or mini spatula. Serve them immediately. If you have any leftovers, store them in the fridge, and eat them within 3 to 5 days.

methods.name: Making Spinach and Red Pepper Frittatas

steps.headline: Preheat your oven to 375°F (190°C) and lightly grease a 12-hole, regular-sized muffin pan.
steps.description: You can also use a 24-hole mini muffin, but you will need to adjust the cooking time later on. Set baking rack in the middle of the oven.

steps.headline: Sauté the peppers and onions over medium-high heat.
steps.description: Heat 1 teaspoon of olive oil in a medium-sized pan over medium-high heat. Add the diced peppers and onions. Sauté until they turn soft, stirring occasionally. This will take about 5 minutes.

steps.headline: Add the spinach, cook it until it wilts, then set the pan aside.
steps.description: Roughly chop the spinach first, then add it into the pan. Continue cooking, stirring often, until the spinach wilts. Remove the pan from the burner and set it aside.

steps.headline: Whisk together the eggs, milk, cheese, salt, and pepper.
steps.description: Crack open the eggs into a large mixing bowl. Add the milk, cheese, salt, and pepper. Whisk everything together until the yolks break and the mixture turns a pale yellow color.

steps.headline: Fill each muffin well up to ⅔ of the way full with the egg mixture.
steps.description: Use a soup or sauce ladle to measure out the egg mixture. This will ensure that each well gets the same amount.

steps.headline: Add the sautéed vegetables into each well.
steps.description: Use a tablespoon to measure out the vegetables so that each well gets the same amount.

steps.headline: Bake the frittatas.
steps.description: They are ready when they puff up and turn golden brown, about 20 to 25 minutes. If you used a mini muffin pan, they will be ready in about 8 to 10 minutes.

steps.headline: Serve the mini frittatas.
steps.description: Remove them from the muffin pan using a fork or mini spatula. Serve them right away. If you have any left over, keep them in the fridge for up to 3 to 5 days.

steps.headline: Preheat your oven to 350°F (175°C) and lightly grease a 12-hole, regular muffin pan.
steps.description:
You can also use a 24-hole mini muffin, but you will need to adjust the cooking time. {"smallUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/0\/0c\/Make-Mini-Frittatas-Step-15.jpg","bigUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/0\/0c\/Make-Mini-Frittatas-Step-15.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":307,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":508,"licensing":"

\n<\/p>


\n<\/p><\/div>"} Make sure that the baking rack is set in the center.

steps.headline: Prepare your add-ins.
steps.description: A basic frittata contains eggs, salt, and pepper. You will want to add in additional ingredients to make it more flavorful. Great choices include things like bacon, cheese, ham, sausage, tomatoes, and other vegetables. Dice and chop everything into smaller pieces. Make sure that any meat you will be using is already cooked. Consider sautéing onions and peppers beforehand.

steps.headline: Whisk the eggs, salt, and pepper.
steps.description: Crack the eggs open into a large bowl. Add in the salt and pepper. Whisk everything together until the yolks break, and the mixture turns pale yellow. You can use more/less salt and pepper. If you want lighter frittatas, use 6 eggs (yolks + whites) and 4 egg whites (no yolks). Consider adding in ½ cup (120 milliliters) of whole milk. This will make the frittatas creamier.

steps.headline: Fill the muffin wells ⅔ of the way.
steps.description: Use a soup or sauce ladle to fill the wells. This way, you can ensure that each well gets the same amount. Do not fill the wells all the way to the brim. This leaves room for the add-ins.

steps.headline: Add in your prepared add-ins.
steps.description: Each well gets 2 to 3 teaspoons of the add-ins. You can get really creative and mix-and-match. If you are making these for you family, consider setting out the add-ins in separate bowls, then let everyone create their own mini frittata.

steps.headline: Bake the frittatas for 20 to 22 minutes.
steps.description: Check them after 20 minutes. They will puff up as they bake, and slowly deflate once you take them out of the oven. They are done when they are set in the middle. If you used a mini muffin pan, bake the frittatas for 8 to 10 minutes. Check them after 8 minutes.

steps.headline: Serve the mini frittatas.
steps.description: Use a fork or mini spatula to pop them out of the muffin pan. If you have any leftovers, store them in the fridge, and eat them within 3 to 5 days.

text:
Making Ham and Cheese Frittatas Preheat your oven to 375°F (190°C) and grease two regular-sized, 12-well muffin pans. This recipe will give you about 20 frittatas. You can also use two 24-well mini muffin tins instead. This will give you about 40 extra-small frittatas. Make sure that the baking rack is in the middle of the oven. Whisk together the eggs, milk, pepper and salt. Crack open the eggs into a large mixing bowl. Add the milk, pepper, and salt. Whisk everything together until the yolks break and the mixture turns pale yellow. You can adjust the amounts of salt and pepper to suit your tastes. Add in the ham, cheese, and parsley. If you have not already, chop the ham into smaller pieces. Add it into the mixing bowl, along with the cheese and parsley. Stir everything together with a rubber spatula, scrapping the bottom and sides of the bowl often. If you can't find fresh parsley, use 2 teaspoons of dried parsley instead. If you don't like Parmesan, of can't find any, Cheddar cheese would make a great, tasty substitute. Fill the muffin wells with the mixture. Use a soup or sauce ladle to fill the wells about ⅔ of the way. You have enough mixture to fill about 20 regular-sized muffin wells, or 40 mini muffin wells. Bake the frittatas until they set. This will take about 20 to 25 minutes for regular-sized muffin pans and 8 to 10 minutes for mini muffin wells. As they bake, the frittatas will puff up slightly. Serve the mini frittatas. Pop them out of the wells using a fork or mini spatula. Serve them immediately. If you have any leftovers, store them in the fridge, and eat them within 3 to 5 days. Making Spinach and Red Pepper Frittatas Preheat your oven to 375°F (190°C) and lightly grease a 12-hole, regular-sized muffin pan. You can also use a 24-hole mini muffin, but you will need to adjust the cooking time later on. Set baking rack in the middle of the oven. Sauté the peppers and onions over medium-high heat. Heat 1 teaspoon of olive oil in a medium-sized pan over medium-high heat. Add the diced peppers and onions. Sauté until they turn soft, stirring occasionally. This will take about 5 minutes. Add the spinach, cook it until it wilts, then set the pan aside. Roughly chop the spinach first, then add it into the pan. Continue cooking, stirring often, until the spinach wilts. Remove the pan from the burner and set it aside. Whisk together the eggs, milk, cheese, salt, and pepper. Crack open the eggs into a large mixing bowl. Add the milk, cheese, salt, and pepper. Whisk everything together until the yolks break and the mixture turns a pale yellow color. Fill each muffin well up to ⅔ of the way full with the egg mixture. Use a soup or sauce ladle to measure out the egg mixture. This will ensure that each well gets the same amount. Add the sautéed vegetables into each well. Use a tablespoon to measure out the vegetables so that each well gets the same amount. Bake the frittatas. They are ready when they puff up and turn golden brown, about 20 to 25 minutes. If you used a mini muffin pan, they will be ready in about 8 to 10 minutes. Serve the mini frittatas. Remove them from the muffin pan using a fork or mini spatula. Serve them right away. If you have any left over, keep them in the fridge for up to 3 to 5 days. Making Custom Frittatas Preheat your oven to 350°F (175°C) and lightly grease a 12-hole, regular muffin pan. You can also use a 24-hole mini muffin, but you will need to adjust the cooking time. {"smallUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/0\/0c\/Make-Mini-Frittatas-Step-15.jpg","bigUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/0\/0c\/Make-Mini-Frittatas-Step-15.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":307,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":508,"licensing":"

License: Creative Commons<\/a>
\n<\/p>


\n<\/p><\/div>"} Make sure that the baking rack is set in the center. Prepare your add-ins. A basic frittata contains eggs, salt, and pepper. You will want to add in additional ingredients to make it more flavorful. Great choices include things like bacon, cheese, ham, sausage, tomatoes, and other vegetables. Dice and chop everything into smaller pieces. Make sure that any meat you will be using is already cooked. Consider sautéing onions and peppers beforehand. Whisk the eggs, salt, and pepper. Crack the eggs open into a large bowl. Add in the salt and pepper. Whisk everything together until the yolks break, and the mixture turns pale yellow. You can use more/less salt and pepper. If you want lighter frittatas, use 6 eggs (yolks + whites) and 4 egg whites (no yolks). Consider adding in ½ cup (120 milliliters) of whole milk. This will make the frittatas creamier. Fill the muffin wells ⅔ of the way. Use a soup or sauce ladle to fill the wells. This way, you can ensure that each well gets the same amount. Do not fill the wells all the way to the brim. This leaves room for the add-ins. Add in your prepared add-ins. Each well gets 2 to 3 teaspoons of the add-ins. You can get really creative and mix-and-match. If you are making these for you family, consider setting out the add-ins in separate bowls, then let everyone create their own mini frittata. Bake the frittatas for 20 to 22 minutes. Check them after 20 minutes. They will puff up as they bake, and slowly deflate once you take them out of the oven. They are done when they are set in the middle. If you used a mini muffin pan, bake the frittatas for 8 to 10 minutes. Check them after 8 minutes. Serve the mini frittatas. Use a fork or mini spatula to pop them out of the muffin pan. If you have any leftovers, store them in the fridge, and eat them within 3 to 5 days.
